Content: Select the ùóßùóõùó•ùóòùóò rational numbers.
Lamar has a container filled with nickels that have a value of $51.45. He has 4 other identical containers with nickels. Of the 4 other identical containers,

:ibox:‚Ä¢ 2 of them are full,
‚Ä¢ 1 of them is 3/4 full, and
‚Ä¢ 1 of them is 1/2 full.

Lamar estimates that the total value of all 5 containers of nickels is approximately $250. Which statement ùóïùóòùó¶ùóß explains why Lamar‚Äôs estimate is likely an overestimate or an underestimate?

A.Choice: Lamar‚Äôs estimate is likely an underestimate because 5 √ó $51 = $255.

B.Choice: Lamar‚Äôs estimate is likely an underestimate because it is likely that at least one of the other 2 full containers contains more than $51.45.

C.Choice: Lamar‚Äôs estimate is likely an overestimate because he has just over 4 full containers, and 4 √ó $50 = $200.

D.Choice: Lamar‚Äôs estimate is likely an overestimate because it is doubtful that the other full containers are worth exactly $51.45.

Content: A recipe calls for 2 1/3 cups of flour. Jane needs to make only half of the recipe. Which expression could Jane use to calculate the number of cups of flour she needs?

Emanuel is planting trees along a new city sidewalk. He plants the same number of trees on each city block. After 3 blocks, he has planted 15 trees. After 5 blocks, he has planted 25 trees. At what rate is Emanuel planting trees?

Diego does a science experiment. In the experiment, he mixes two chemicals together and immediately measures the mixture‚Äôs temperature. One hour later, he measures the mixture‚Äôs temperature again. He records the two temperatures as mand n. The temperature of the mixture immediately after creating it, m, is 1.75¬∞C. The value of |m‚Äì n| is 2.25¬∞C.
Plot the minimum ùóîùó°ùóó maximum values for n, the temperature of the mixture one hour later.
An expression is shown.
Select the ùóßùó™ùó¢ expressions that are equivalent to the given expression.

A cat receives 0.15 milliliter of medicine for every 2.5 pounds that it weighs. Tabby is a cat that weighs 9.75 pounds. How much medicine, rounded to the nearest hundredth of a milliliter, should Tabby receive?

On a softball team, the number of 7th graders is proportional to the number of 8th graders. Which graph could model the relationship between the number of 7th graders and 8th graders on the softball team?
A cylinder is sliced parallel to its base, as shown.
problems/MOG7M/media/9a.jpg
Which figure represents the two-dimensional cross section?
Whenever Hannah turns on her cell phone, it randomly shows a background image from a group of 6 images Hannah has selected. Of the 6 images Hannah has selected,

:ibox:‚Ä¢ exactly 2 are of her friends,
‚Ä¢ exactly 3 are of her family members, and
‚Ä¢ exactly 1 is of her pet dog.
What is the probability that the cell phone shows an image other than the pet dog the next time Hannah turns on her cell phone?
What is 4 √∑ (‚Äì2.5)?
Christopher has a website. He updates his website the same number of times each week.

:ibox:‚Ä¢ After 3 weeks, Christopher had updated his website a total of 12 times.
‚Ä¢ After 5 weeks, Christopher had updated his website a total of 20 times.

Christopher makes a graph to show the relationship between the number of weeks that have passed, x, and the number of times he has updated his website, y. Use the numbers below the blank lines to show the coordinates of the point that represents the unit rate, in updates per week, of Christopher‚Äôs graph.

Chad is putting a frame around a picture. He needs to decide whether he wants the frame to be black or brown. He also needs to decide whether he wants the frame to be made of metal or of wood. Finally, he needs to decide whether he wants the picture covered with glass or with plastic. He makes a list of his options as shown.
Which option did Chad forget to include in his list?
A sprinkler waters a circular region in Jason‚Äôs yard that has a radius of 15 feet. Rounded to the nearest square foot, what is the area of the circular region that is watered by the sprinkler?
What is the solution to the equation 2(x+ 2.4) = 6.4?
A store is offering a 30% discount on shirts. A shirt at the store has an original cost of $25. What is the cost of the shirt, in dollars, after the discount?

In a mine, 0.6% of all the mined material is copper. The company that runs the mine needs the mine to produce more than 0.81 million tons of copper to make a profit this year. The mine has already produced 0.75 million tons of copper this year. The inequality below represents x, the additional millions of tons of material that need to be mined this year for the mine to make a profit.
Which inequality shows all the possible values of x?

There are 50 tickets in a jar. Each ticket is either red or blue. Jeanette randomly draws 10 tickets from the jar, counts the number of red tickets, and then replaces the tickets. She does this 8 times. The list shows how many red tickets Jeanette drew on each attempt.
What is the ùóïùóòùó¶ùóß estimate for the total number of red tickets in the jar?
Jamar is buying bottles of juice for his class party. A pack of 12 bottles of juice costs $3.96. Which expression could Jamaruse to determine the cost of 1 bottle of juice?

Carter writes the expression 0.25x + 1.75y + 0.25y + 1.5xy. He wants to rewrite the expression by combining like terms. For each pair of terms in the table, select whether they are like terms or not like terms.
Nina works at a company that makes cylindrical cans. She finds the area of the base of one of the cans and then multiplies that area by the height of the can. What is Nina most likely calculating?

A club is selling cookies to earn money. The club is going to donate 1/4 of the money to charity and keep the rest. The total cookie sales are $367.20. Which expression could be used to determine the amount of money the club will keep?
Arie has a bag that contains 15 yellow marbles, 13 blue marbles, and 22 red marbles. Select the ùóßùó™ùó¢ statements that are true when Arie randomly draws 10 marbles from the bag.

A.Choice: She is likely to draw all red marbles.

B.Choice: She is likely to draw more blue marbles than red marbles.

C.Choice: She is likely to draw more red marbles than yellow marbles.

D.Choice: She is likely to draw about the same number of yellow and blue marbles.

E.Choice: She is likely to draw more red marbles than yellow and blue marbles combined.

Content: Li put $75 into his savings account. The money was 1/3 of his paycheck. Which equation could be used to find the amount of money, p, in dollars, on his paycheck?
Charlie is charging his tablet. The graph shows how long it takes for his tablet to charge.
problems/MOG7M/media/25a.jpg
Which statement about the ordered pair (5, 25) is true?

A.Choice: It takes 5 minutes to charge 25 tablets.

B.Choice: It takes 25 minutes to charge 5 tablets.

C.Choice: It takes 5 minutes to charge 1 tablet to 25%.

D.Choice: It takes 25 minutes to charge 1 tablet to 5%.

:ibox:‚Äì2x + 12 < 18
What is the solution to the inequality?

:ibox:‚Äì3(x ‚Äì 4)
Which expression is equivalent to the given expression?
Linda ate 1/8 of a batch of cornbread. Peter ate some cornbread so that there is 2/3 of the batch remaining. What fraction of the batch of cornbread did Peter eat?
A proportional relationship is shown.
problems/MOG7M/media/29a.jpg
What is the constant of proportionality?

Jorge wants to buy his father a gift that costs $32. He has already saved $18 for the gift. Jorge saves the same amount of money each week for the next 4 weeks. How much money, in dollars, will Jorge have to save each week to have exactly enough money to buy his father the gift?
Lily tosses a fair coin in the air 20 times and records the results. The coin lands with the tails side up in 12 of the 20 trials. Which statement about Lily‚Äôs trials is correct?

A.Choice: The theoretical probability is 50%, because at least 50% of Lily‚Äôs coin tosses landed with the tails side up.

B.Choice: The theoretical probability of landing with the tails side up is 12/20 = 60%, because that is what Lily observed.

C.Choice: The experimental probability is 50%, because at least 50% of Lily‚Äôs coin tosses landed with the tails side up.

D.Choice: The experimental probability of landing with the tails side up is 12/20 = 60%, because that is what Lily observed.

Content: Lines m and n are shown.
problems/MOG7M/media/32a.jpg
Angle A measures 38¬∞. What is the measure, in degrees, of angle B?
Louis went to a movie with $20.00. The ticket cost $9.50, and he spent $2.75 on snacks. How much money did Louis have left over?
Julia uses a scale to weigh three identical stacks of coins.

:ibox:‚Ä¢ The scale has a maximum percent error of 3%.
‚Ä¢ The scale says the weight of the first stack of coins is 10.0 ounces.
‚Ä¢ The scale says the weight of the second stack of coins is 10.3 ounces.
Rounded to the nearest tenth of an ounce, what is the greatest possible amount that the scale could say for the weight of the third stack of coins?

Class X and class Y each have 20 students. They each keep track of the number of books each student reads in one month. The mean number of books read by the students in class X is 4.2 books. The mean number of books read by the students in class Y is 3.8 books. Select the ùóßùó™ùó¢ statements that are true.

A.Choice: Every student in class X read more books than any student in class Y.

B.Choice: The students in class X like reading more than the students in class Y.

C.Choice: The students in class X read longer books than the students in class Y.

D.Choice: On average, the students in class X read more books than the students in class Y.

E.Choice: The total number of books read by class X is more than the total number of books read by class Y.

Content: Ella designs a glass tabletop for a restaurant. She makes the scale drawing shown.
problems/MOG7M/media/36a.jpg

In Ella‚Äôs scale drawing, the length of each square on the grid represents 12 inches. Make a new scale drawing of Ella‚Äôs tabletop in which the length of each square on the grid represents 6 inches. The plotted point in Ella‚Äôs new scale drawing should correspond to the plotted point in Ella‚Äôs original scale drawing.
Chelsea buys a bag of apples. In the bag, 8/11 of the apples are green. Which number could also represent the portion of the apples in the bag that are green?
A triangle has sides that are 4 units, 6 units, and m units long. Select the ùóßùó™ùó¢ numbers that are possible values of m.
Sophia earned $18 for working 2 1/4 hours. How much did she earn per hour?
A library keeps track of the number of overdue items at the end of each month.

:ibox:‚Ä¢ At the end of April, there were x overdue items.
‚Ä¢ At the end of May, the number of overdue items was 3% less than the number of overdue items at the end of April.

The expression x ‚Äì 0.03x represents the number of overdue items at the end of May. Which sentence ùóïùóòùó¶ùóß explains how to simplify the expression that represents the number of overdue items at the end of May?

A.Choice: Combine x and 0.03x, since they are like terms, by canceling out the x.

B.Choice: Combine x and 0.03x, since they are like terms, by subtracting 1 ‚Äì 0.03 to find the new coefficient.

C.Choice: Factor out an x, since it appears in both terms, leaving 1 in the first term and 0.03xin the second term.

D.Choice: Factor out an x, since it appears in both terms, eliminating the first term and leaving 0.03 in the second term.

Content: The graph shows the number of hours it takes to assemble several items at a shipping warehouse.
problems/MOG7M/media/41a.jpg
What does the point (3, 6) represent?

A.Choice: It takes 3 hours to assemble 1 item at the shipping warehouse.

B.Choice: It takes 3 hours to assemble 6 items at the shipping warehouse.

C.Choice: It takes 6 hours to assemble 1 item at the shipping warehouse.

D.Choice: It takes 6 hours to assemble 3 items at the shipping warehouse.

Gary has a box of pencils. In the box, 7/21 of the pencils have been sharpened. Select the ùóßùóõùó•ùóòùóò fractions that are proportional to the fraction of sharpened pencils in Gary‚Äôs box.
Ricardo has a coupon for 25% off his purchase at a craft store. Which expression could Ricardo use to calculate his ùóßùó¢ùóßùóîùóü ùóñùó¢ùó¶ùóß when purchasing x dollars of craft supplies?
Which situation applies an additive inverse to find the total amount of money?

B.Choice: Dylan found $5 and then found $5 more.

C.Choice: Dylan spent $5 and then gave $3 to a friend.

D.Choice: Dylan found $5 and then kept the money in his pocket.

Content: Emma is buying a shirt for each member of her school‚Äôs spirit club. There are 300 students in her school, and 20% of the students are members of the spirit club. Reagan and Jordan want to purchase a new bed for their dog. All beds at Paul‚Äôs Pets are 50% off. While they are shopping, the store announces a special sale for an additional 20% off the discounted price for all items. The bed Reagan and Jordan want to purchase costs $45 before any discounts are applied.
Reagan claims that pet beds are now 70% off. Jordan disagrees and claims that the total discount is not 70%. Who is correct? Provide mathematical evidence for your reasoning.
Be sure to include the final cost of the bed for Reagan‚Äôs claim.
